attributes.action: Extend the gambling law to include "loot boxes" and other predatory mechanics.
attributes.additional_details:
Currently, there is a loophole in the law. If the game doesn't reward you monetarily, it is not considered gambling.

https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/technology-48925623

https://www.theguardian.com/games/2018/aug/17/video-game-loot-boxes-addictive-and-a-form-of-simulated-gambling-senate-inquiry-told

https://www.theverge.com/2019/2/19/18226852/loot-boxes-gaming-regulation-gambling-free-to-play

https://www.theguardian.com/society/2019/jun/24/nhs-to-open-first-ever-gambling-clinic-for-children
attributes.background: With more and more evidence emerging about kids spending thousands on games which employ the same psychological tricks and carry the same risks of addiction like gambling, we believe that the law should be extended to include those games as they are currently unlicensed and aimed at children.
